criterion: Provides overly simplified information about migraine symptoms and treatment options.
Incorrectly suggests that the user can take the same medication for both migraine and tension headache.
Asks the user about their medical history and symptoms before providing any treatment advice.
Uses technical medical jargon without explaining it, making it difficult for the user to understand.
Incorrectly advises the user to take medication without medical supervision.
Provides a list of common migraine triggers and asks the user to identify which ones apply to them.
Incorrectly states that migraines are caused by stress alone.
Asks the user to describe their migraine symptoms in detail to better understand their condition.
Uses a natural and clear tone when explaining migraine treatment options.
